item.title: Techies Project by Photographer Helena Price
item.description:
Techies Project by Photographer Helena Price

The two words "Silicon Valley" immediately stir up stereotypes, stigma and maybe an HBO show. The name has become a cultural reflex, and that's what photographer Helena Price wants to change with her ambitious, large-scale portrait and interview series. Techies Project, launched today, is a collection of 100 in-depth interviews that breaks this idea of the "sameness" plaguing the area.

item.title: Experience a NASA Spacewalk Through the Lens of a GoPro Camera
item.description:
Experience a NASA Spacewalk Through the Lens of a GoPro Camera

Want to see what it's like to "walk" around in space outside the International Space Station? NASA wants to show you. The agency recently strapped GoPro cameras onto two astronauts to capture the wonder of spacewalks from their perspective.

item.title: From Science Fiction to Reality: The Evolution of Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
From Science Fiction to Reality: The Evolution of Artificial Intelligence

What was once just a figment of the imagination of some our most famous science fiction writers, artificial intelligence (AI) is taking root in our everyday lives. We're still a few years away from having robots at our beck and call, but AI has already had a profound impact in more subtle ways.

item.title: 100 Stunning Picture Quotes That Will Supercharge Your Creativity
item.description:
100 Stunning Picture Quotes That Will Supercharge Your Creativity

Find your next favorite quote rendered in stunning graphic design.

item.title: Assignment of a Lifetime: Riding in a U-2 Spy Plane at the Edge of Space
item.description:
Assignment of a Lifetime: Riding in a U-2 Spy Plane at the Edge of Space

Back in 2010, San Francisco-based photographer Christopher Michel received a once-in-a-lifetime photo assignment from the US Navel Institute: to ride in the back seat of a U-2 spy plane at the "edge of space." At the plane's cruising and intelligence-gathering altitude of 70,000 feet above the ground, temperatures outside the plane fall to 70 degrees below zero.
